SEARCH
Package ReliableMulticast.Receiver

Class Receiver

java.lang.Object
ReliableMulticast.Receiver.Receiver
public class Receiver extends Object
The Receiver class represents a receiver in a reliable multicast system. It receives data from a multicast group and processes it using a worker thread.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final DatagramChannel
    channel
    The DatagramChannel used to receive data.

    ignoredClasses

    The ReceiverListener used to listen for incoming data.

    The ReceiverWorker used to process received data.
    private final Sender
    sender
    The Sender object used to send retransmission requests.
    private final BlockingQueue<Object>
    workerQueue
    The workerQueue used to store final received objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Receiver

      public Receiver(Sender sender, String interfaceAddress, String multicastGroup, int port, Class<?>[] ignoredClasses, UUID multicastID) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Constructs a Receiver object.
      Parameters:
      sender - the sender object used to send retransmission requests
      interfaceAddress - the IP address of the network interface to use for multicast
      multicastGroup - the IP address of the multicast group
      port - the port number to bind the receiver to
      ignoredClasses - an array of classes to ignore when processing received data
      multicastID - the unique identifier for the multicast session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting

  • Method Details

    • receive

      public void receive() throws InterruptedException, IOException
      Starts receiving data from the multicast group.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • getWorkerQueue

      public BlockingQueue<Object> getWorkerQueue()
      Gets the workerQueue used to store final received objects.
      Returns:
      the workerQueue

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops receiving data and cleans up resources.
